In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the solution using Julia DataFrames package:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df[:dt])
    return df
end
```

This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and adds a new column `ym` to it. The values in this new column are calculated by mapping over the `dt` column of the DataFrame, extracting the year and month from each DateTime value, concatenating them together into an integer format "yyyymm", and assigning these values to the new column `ym`.

You can use this function like so:
```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=DateTime[now()-Month(i) for i in 1:3])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
